Package Model

Class Tour

java.lang.Object
ObserverDP.Observable
Model.Tour
public class Tour extends Observable
Tour implements the interface Observable in order to apply the Observer design pattern. Tour is the class representing a tour.
A tour is characterized by:
  • A tour departure which is the stop where the tour begins with a zero seconds stop duration.
  • A departure time which is the time in hh:mm:ss format when the tour begins.
  • An arrival time which is the time in hh:mm:ss format when the tour is finished.
  • A list of tour requests that must be accomplished during the tour.
  • An ordered travel that is a list of stops containing all the paths to follow and the time of the departure from the arrival stop of each path in order to accomplish the tour optimally.
  • A pickup stop that is the pickup stop that will be added to the tour when calling an add request command.
  • A delivery stop that is the delivery stop that will be added to the tour when calling an add request command.
  • A pickup stop predecessor that is the predecessor of the pickup stop that will be added to the tour when calling an add request command.
  • A delivery stop predecessor that is the predecessor of the delivery stop that will be added to the tour when calling an add request command.
Author:
H4122
See Also:
Observable, AddRequestCommand

  • Constructor Details

    • Tour

      public Tour()
      Default Tour constructor. Calls the constructor of Observable interface it implements. The tour requests and the order travel are initialized as empty lists. The tour departure, the pickup stop, the delivery stop, the pickup stop predecessor and the delivery stop predecessor are initialized using the default constructor of Stop.
      See Also:
      Observable(), Stop()

    • Tour

      public Tour​(Stop tourDeparture, Date departureTime, Date arrivalTime, ArrayList<Request> tourRequests)
      Constructor of Tour. Calls the constructor of Observable interface it implements. When the tour is created, the tour departure, the departure time, the arrival time and the tour requests are initialized with the corresponding parameters. The ordered travel is initialized as an empty list. The pickup stop, the delivery stop, the pickup stop predecessor and the delivery stop predecessor are initialized using the default constructor of Stop.
      Parameters:
      tourDeparture - The stop which is the tour departure
      departureTime - The departure time of the tour
      arrivalTime - The arrival time of the tour
      tourRequests - The requests list of the tour
      See Also:
      Observable(), Stop(), tourDeparture, departureTime, arrivalTime, tourRequests

    • getStopById

      public Stop getStopById​(long id)
      Returns a Stop, which is the stop that corresponds to the given id, if it exists in the tour requests, or else to an empty stop.
      Parameters:
      id - The id of the stop we are looking for
      Returns:
      the stop corresponding to the given id.
      See Also:
      Stop
